results.title: A Red ribbon
results.creator_credit: Ard Norddeutscher Rundfunk, Patricia De Rossi, Pedro Jose Frank Nemeth and Marc De Rossi
results.brief_description: A non-narrated story with simply a musical score background about a young boy’s unsuccessful attempts to fly a kite. Discouraged he gives up and goes home. However, his female companion comes to his rescue with the aid of her red hair ribbon which she attaches to the tail of the kite. A sensitive film that raises issues about the value of friendship and co-operation. Music by Vincente Salvia. Cast: Ledice Fernandes de Oliviera, Marcos da Silva. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: A Record of pre-school play
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Australian Council for Educational Research
results.brief_description: These children are representative of 100 who commenced primary school in Carlton during 1951. Some children had attended the Lady Gowrie Pre-School Centre, some came from other kindergartens and creches and some had not attended any pre-school centre. The children were assembled for two weeks at the end of 1950 to study their vocabulary and this film was made of their unrehearsed and undirected activities. Photography by Rodney Power.

results.title: A Recital of faith
results.brief_description: In 1940 R.S. Reynolds and his metals company were concerned at the low volume of US aluminium production. They decided to produce enough to make 50,000 planes. A new plant was built the same year and was in operation only five months later. The manufacturing processes of making aluminium is shown in detail.

results.title: A Reason to read
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Malcolm Smith and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Studies the actions of students at three age levels- 5, 11 and 15 years and shows that in order to learn to read they must first want to read. It proposes that activities related to the teaching of reading should arise from the students own experience and interests, and that students should participate in the decision making concerning these activities. Features Croydon High, Enfield Junior and Gilles Street Primary schools.

results.title: A Real rodeo. Fun fair. Felix out of luck. [compilation]
results.brief_description: A compilation of three short films. 1. A Real rodeo: Roping and typing a steer contest; horse and rider in bucking contest; steer bulldogging; queen of the rodeo. 2. Fun fair: Swing high - swing low; the gypsy’s warning; on the target; merry-go-round; steam-boat swing 3. Felix out of luck: animated cartoon.

results.title: A Rat in the building
results.brief_description: This clever clay animation film centres around a gathering of elderly women neighbours who meet for their weekly gossip. Item number one on the agenda, “rats” (whom one presumes represents men), and those women who are devilish enough to keep them in a building that prohibits their existence. Adapted from a short story by Olga Masters and featuring the voices of Penny Biggins and Gretel Killeen.

results.title: A Rat's tale = Die Story von Monty Spinnerratz
results.creator_credit: Monty Filmgesellschaft, Warner Bros Pictures, Hans Peter Clahsen and Michael F. Huse
results.brief_description: Featuring marionettes from Germany’s Augsburger Puppet Theatre, this is a love story with a difference, where the action is below the city streets and the star crossed lovers are rodents. The story is a combination of the children’s book by Tor Seidler and illustrated by Fred Marcellino, and an elaboration on a short story pilot by Monty Spinnerratz. Isabella Noble-Rat is swept off her feet by Monty Mad-Rat Jnr. after an impressive tour of New York’s underground sewers. Her parents are against their daughter’s union with someone beneath their station, much to Isabella’s chagrin. There are bigger issues at hand however as the rat community is threatened by rising drain waters and a proposed mass extermination of the rodent community. Perhaps Isabella’s beau can save the day and impress her snooty parents at the same time. Cast includes Beverly D’Angelo, Jerry Stiller, Josef Ostendorf and Lauren Hutton, and featuring the voices of Lynsey Bartilson, Ray Guth, Scott MacDonald and Donald Arthur.

results.title: A Rag tapestry by 25 children
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan and George Zabriskie
results.brief_description: A series of workshops for children at the Metropolitan Museum of Art reveals the entire process involved in making a rag tapestry. Follows process from initial concept through drawing to production. Using wool scraps the 8-12 year-olds create, at little cost, a colorful 3 x 10 foot tapestry.

results.title: A Race of horses
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Kit Denton
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the breeding and training of racehorses in Australia. Includes scenes of foaling, breaking-in and handling the young horses, and an actual race sequence. Photographed by renown cameraman Dean Semler.

results.title: A Race against people: the story of Hong Kong's re-housing programme
results.creator_credit: Hong Kong Film Unit and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The story of Hong Kong’s Re-housing Program. The re-settlement of new migrants and other Chinese members of the community in to high-rise housing provided by the authorities at public expense. Commentary by Eamonn Andrews.
